skill.name: webapp-testing
skill.description: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using Playwright. Supports verifying frontend functionality, debugging UI behavior, capturing browser screenshots, and viewing browser logs.
skill.summary: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using Playwright. Supports verifying...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate webapp testing toolkit. The code behavior matches its stated purpose of managing local dev servers and running Playwright automation scripts. No data exfiltration or suspicious network activity detected.

low_findings.title: Shell command execution via subprocess
low_findings.description: The script uses subprocess.Popen with shell=True to execute server commands. This allows arbitrary command execution but is necessary for managing local development servers and is user-initiated.

content.value_statement: Testing local web applications requires setting up servers, navigating pages, and verifying frontend behavior. This toolkit provides Playwright automation scripts and server lifecycle management for efficient testing.
actual_capabilities: Write Python Playwright scripts for web automation
Capture browser screenshots and DOM content
Discover and interact with page elements
Test both static HTML and dynamic web applications
limitations: Only works with local web applications
Does not perform visual regression testing

use_cases.title: Verify UI Behavior
use_cases.description: Automate clicking, filling forms, and checking page state for web applications.

use_cases.title: End-to-End Testing
use_cases.description: Create automated test scripts that verify frontend functionality without manual browser testing.

use_cases.title: Capture Dynamic Content
use_cases.description: Extract data from dynamically rendered pages by waiting for JavaScript execution.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Page Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the webapp-testing skill to launch a Chromium browser in headless mode, navigate to http://localhost:5173, wait for network idle, take a screenshot, and verify the page title.

prompt_templates.title: Element Discovery
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the webapp-testing skill to discover all buttons, links, and input fields on the local page at http://localhost:5173. Print the count and descriptions of each element found.

prompt_templates.title: Form Automation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the webapp-testing skill to navigate to the local webapp, fill in a form with test data, submit it, wait for the response, and capture any console error messages.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Server Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the with_server.py helper to start a backend server on port 3000 and a frontend server on port 5173. Then run a Playwright script that tests the connection between both services.

output_examples.input: Navigate to my local React app on port 5173, find all buttons, and take a screenshot
output: Found 5 buttons: Submit, Cancel, Save Changes, Delete Account, Help
Found 3 input fields: username (text), email (email), password (password)

best_practices: Always use headless mode for automated testing to avoid browser GUI overhead.
Wait for network idle state before inspecting dynamic web applications.
Use the with_server.py helper script to manage server lifecycle automatically.
anti_patterns: Inspecting DOM before waiting for network idle on dynamic applications.
Skipping browser close after test completion.
Using flaky selectors without proper waiting strategies.

faq.question: Does this skill work with browsers other than Chromium?
faq.answer: Yes, Playwright supports Chromium, Firefox, and WebKit. Modify browser.launch() with the desired browser type.

faq.question: Can I test password-protected pages?
faq.answer: Yes, use page.fill() to enter credentials and page.click() to submit login forms before testing protected content.

faq.question: Do I need to install Playwright separately?
faq.answer: Yes, run pip install playwright and playwright install to install browsers before using this skill.

faq.question: How do I handle single-page applications?
faq.answer: Use page.wait_for_load_state('networkidle') after navigation to wait for JavaScript to complete rendering.

faq.question: Is my data safe when running these scripts?
faq.answer: Yes, scripts run locally on your machine. No data is sent to external servers. Files are written to /tmp/ or /mnt/user-data/outputs/.

faq.question: Can I test HTTPS sites or localhost with custom certificates?
faq.answer: Yes, Playwright can accept self-signed certificates. Use ignoreHTTPSErrors option in browser.new_context().
